SEARCH
Package pt.uc.dei.controllers

Class ActivationController

java.lang.Object
pt.uc.dei.controllers.ActivationController
@Path("/activate") public class ActivationController extends Object
REST controller for handling account activation requests.

This endpoint processes activation tokens sent to users via email and manages the account activation workflow including:

  • Token validation
  • Expired token renewal
  • Temporary to permanent account conversion
  • Cleanup of temporary registration data

  • Method Details

    • activateAccount

      @POST @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response activateAccount(@HeaderParam("token") String token)
      Activates a user account using the provided activation token.

      Workflow:

      1. Validates the token exists and is associated with a temporary user
      2. Checks token expiration (renews if expired)
      3. Converts temporary account to permanent
      4. Cleans up temporary data
      Parameters:
      token - Activation token from email link (in header)
      Returns:
      HTTP Response with appropriate status: - 202 (Accepted) for successful activation - 401 (Unauthorized) for invalid tokens - 409 (Conflict) with new token if original expired - 500 (Internal Server Error) for processing failures
